definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: The higher the monkey climbs up the tree, the more he exposes the ugliness of his bald red behind.
sentences.chinese: 猴子爬得愈高，尾部又秃又红的丑相就愈加显露。

sentences.english: Nick's born clown. Just the sight of him is enough to make you fall about laughing.
sentences.chinese: 尼克天生一付丑相，看他一眼就会使你忍不住大笑。

definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
morally loose, lewd and low, lascivious and mean/wanton
facial expression of good fortune/joyous and contented look
